00022 /**

00025  * @date   Fri Jan  4 16:31:26 PST 2008
00026  *
00027  * @brief  Class for reporting results from multiple quantification methods
00028  */
00029 
00030 //
00031 #include "chipstream/MultiQuantMethodListener.h"
00032 //
00033 #include <cstdlib>
00034 #include <iostream>
00035 //
00036 
00037 using namespace std;
00038 
00039 /**
00040  * Get set up for a run of reporting probesets. Often used to open file
00041  * streams and print headers to files etc.
00042  *
00043  * @param qMethod - Quantification method to be used.
00044  *
00045  * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00046  */
00047 bool MultiQuantMethodListener::prepare(QuantMethod &qMethod, const IntensityMart &iMart)
00048 {
00049   return true;
00050 }
00051 
00052 /**
00053  * After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity
00054  * to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.
00055  *
00056  * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00057  * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00058  *
00059  * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00060  */
00061 bool MultiQuantMethodListener::report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup,
00062                                       QuantMethod &qMethod,
00063                                       const IntensityMart &iMart,
00064                                       std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans,
00065                                       PmAdjuster &pmAdjust)
00066 {
00067   QuantExprMethod *eMethod = dynamic_cast<QuantExprMethod *>(&qMethod);
00068   if(eMethod == NULL) {
00069     Err::errAbort("Can only use a QuantMethodExprReport with a QuantExprMethod.");
00070   }
00071   APT_ERR_ASSERT(!psGroup.probeSets.empty(),"Cant have and empty psGroup.");
00072 
00073   // We only report expression probe sets.
00074   if(psGroup.probeSets[0]->psType != ProbeSet::Expression) {
00075     return false;
00076   }
00077   
00078   // Write signal entry to buffer writer.
00079   vector<double> results;
00080   for (int chip=0; chip<eMethod->getNumTargets(); chip++) {
00081     results.push_back(eMethod->getSignalEstimate(chip));
00082   }
00083   m_Results.push_back(results);
00084   
00085   return true;
00086 }
00087 
00088 /**
00089  * If a probeset fails to compute for whatever reason then this method is
00090  * called rather than the normal report call above. By default does nothing.
00091  *
00092  * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00093  * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00094  *
00095  * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00096  */
00097 bool MultiQuantMethodListener::reportFailure(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup,
00098                                              QuantMethod &qMethod,
00099                                              const IntensityMart &iMart,
00100                                              std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans,
00101                                              PmAdjuster &pmAdjust)
00102 {
00103     return true;
00104 }
00105 
00106 /**
00107  * No more probesets will be processed, this is a chance to finish outputting
00108  * results and clean up.
00109  * @param qMethod - Quantification method that was used.
00110  * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00111  */
00112 bool MultiQuantMethodListener::finish(QuantMethod &qMethod)
00113 {
00114     return true;
00115 }
